recipes.title: 17 Bean White Chicken Chili
recipes.description: 17 Bean White Chicken Chili is an American main course.  This recipe serves 8.

ingredients.name: Beans
ingredients.original: 1 pound Assorted Dry Beans, Cooked According to Package Directions

instructions: 1. Cook your beans according to package directions.
2. Add the broth to a large pot and bring to a boil.
3. Add in the chicken and cook through.
4. Shred chicken and set aside.
5. Mix together the water and cornstarch.
6. Add to broth and boil for a minute until slightly thickened.
7. Add the chicken back into the broth along with the corn, bell pepper, onion, garlic, chiles, tomato, and lime.
8. Add in the spices; the cumin, chile powder, oregano, coriander, crushed pepper, and pepper.
9. Add the cooked beans into the chili along with the cilantro.
10. Salt to taste and let simmer on low heat covered until ready to eat.

recipes.title: Basil Lime White Bean Hummus
recipes.description: Basil Lime White Bean Hummus requires around 45 minutes from start to finish.  One serving contains 96 calories, 4g of protein, and 4g of fat.

ingredients.name: Cannellini Beans
ingredients.original: 15 ounce can of cannellini beans, drained and rinsed

instructions: 1. Combine beans, garlic, basil, lime zest, juice, and olive oil in the food processor and blend until mixed.
2. With the processor on, add water until desired consistency is reached.
3. Add salt and pepper, then taste and add more if needed.
4. Serve with chips or veggies, preferably cold. If you can't wait, eat it right away!

recipes.title: Buffalo Wing Hummus
recipes.description: Buffalo Wing Hummus could be just the gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian, and vegan recipe you've been looking for.  This recipe makes 8 servings with 37 calories, 2g of protein, and 1g of fat each.

ingredients.name: Franks Hot Sauce
ingredients.original: 3 Tablespoons Franks Hot Sauce (try 2 Tbsp. First To Check Spice Factor)

instructions: 1. Put the chickpeas, chickpea liquid, garlic, lemon juice, paprika, celery salt, barbecue sauce, hot sauce, and vinegar in a food processor. Puree until smooth and creamy.

recipes.title: Caprese Quick Bread
recipes.description: Forget going out to eat or ordering takeout every time you crave Mediterranean food.  Try making Caprese Quick Bread at home.

ingredients.name: Flour
ingredients.original: ¾ cups White Whole Wheat Flour

ingredients.name: Weight Lite Mozzarella Cheese
ingredients.original: 4 ounces, weight Lite Mozzarella Cheese, Shredded

ingredients.name: Sundried Tomatoes
ingredients.original: ¼ cups Sundried Tomatoes, Diced, Not Oil Packed

instructions: 1. Heat oven to 35
2. Spray a 9x5x3 loaf pan or two mini bread pans with cooking spray.
3. Stir together flours,cheese, baking powder, basil and salt in medium bowl.
4. Add olive oil, egg and milk, stir till combined. Fold in sundried tomatoes.
5. Pour into pan, drizzle melted butter over top of bread. (Bread will be thick, flatten it out with your fingers)

6. Bake 30 minutes for mini loaf pans and 40  50 minutes for large loaf pan, or until golden brown and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes, remove from pan to wire rack. Cool 30 minutes before slicing, if you can control yourself!

recipes.title: Chavrie Hummus
recipes.description: Chavrie Hummus could be just the gluten free and lacto ovo vegetarian recipe you've been looking for.  This hor d'oeuvre has 195 calories, 11g of protein, and 13g of fat per serving.
instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients and mix well
2. Transfer mixture to a serving dish and refrigerate
3. Serve with your favorite chips

recipes.title: Cilantro Hummus
recipes.description: Need a gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian, and vegan hor d'oeuvre.  Cilantro Hummus could be an amazing recipe to try.

ingredients.name: Garbanzo Beans
ingredients.original: 1 (15 oz) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.original: 1/4 tsp. salt (I used a little less)

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.original: 1/4 c. water (more or less depending on texture you want)

ingredients.name: Olive Oil
ingredients.original: 1 Tbsp. olive oil (more or less depending on texture you want)

ingredients.name: Cilantro
ingredients.original: 1/4 c. cilantro (or more depending on preference) + 3 extra for garnish

instructions: 1. In your food processor, add the garbanzo beans, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, salt and cayenne. Turn on and pulse until mixture is fairly smooth.
2. Start processor running steady and slowly pour in the water, stopping to test the texture, then adding more water if you'd like.
3. Again, with motor running, slowly pour in the olive oil, adding more if you'd like.
4. Stop processor, taste and adjust seasonings, pulse and repeat taste testing until you have it the way you like it.
5. Add cilantro and pulse a few times.
6. Spoon out into a bowl and garnish with a drizzle of olive oil and cilantro if desired.
7. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate.
8. Serve as a dip, spread or however you'd like!

recipes.title: Crispy Rosemary Hummus
recipes.description: You can never have too many middl eastern recipes, so give Crispy Rosemary Hummus a try.  This recipe serves 8.
instructions: 1. Place the oil in a small skillet over high heat.
2. Once smoking, flash-fry the rosemary sprigs for 30 seconds per side.
3. Remove and place on a paper towel, reserving the oil.
4. Place the garbanzo beans in the food processor with the yogurt, rosemary-infused oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt and pepper.
5. Puree to desired  consistency.
6. Pull the crispy rosemary leaves off the stems and place them in the food processor. Pulse until the rosemary has worked through the hummus.
7. Makes 2  cups.

recipes.title: Edamame Hummus
recipes.description: Need a gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian, and vegan hor d'oeuvre.  Edamame Hummus could be an awesome recipe to try.

ingredients.name: Chili Flakes
ingredients.original: ¼ teaspoon chili flakes (if you like it spicy)

ingredients.name: Lemon Zest
ingredients.original: ½ teaspoon freshly grated lemon zest

instructions: 1. Boil the edamame in salted water for 4 to 5 minutes.

2. Drain.In a food processor, puree the Edamame, tahini, water, lemon zest and juice, garlic, salt, cumin, coriander, and chili flakes (optional) until smooth.With the motor running, slowly drizzle in 2 tablespoons of olive oil and mix until absorbed.
3. Transfer to a small bowl, stir in the parsley and drizzle with remaining oil.
4. Serve, or refrigerate, covered, up to 3 days.

recipes.title: Hummus With Tahini Sauce
recipes.description: You can never have too many middl eastern recipes, so give Hummus With Tahini Sauce a try.  This gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian, and vegan recipe serves 2 and costs $1.

ingredients.name: Chickpeas- Any Brand- Drain And Wash
ingredients.original: 1 can Chickpeas- any brand- Drain and wash

ingredients.name: Sumac And Olive
ingredients.original: Parsley, Paprika or Sumac and Olive

instructions: 1. In a food processor mix all the ingredients and process them on high speed.
2. Pour into a serving bowl, garnish with parsley, Sumac, Cumin and Olive Oil, or you may garnish to your liking using whole chickpeas and Olive Oil.

recipes.title: Jalapeno Cheese Quick Bread
recipes.description: The recipe Jalapeno Cheese Quick Bread can be made in around 45 minutes.  For 22 cents per serving, this recipe covers 6% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals.

ingredients.name: Cheddar Cheese
ingredients.original: 1 cup light cheddar cheese (I used a light Mexican blend)

instructions: 1. Heat oven to 350
2. Lightly grease loaf pan, 9x5x3 or two mini muffin pans with cooking spray.
3. Stir together flour, cheese, baking powder, and salt in medium bowl.
4. Add olive oil, egg and milk, stir till combined. Fold in jalapenos.
5. Pour into pan
6. Bake 30 to 45 minutes or until golden brown and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes; run knife around edges of pan to loosen.
7. Remove from pan to wire rack. Cool 30 minutes before slicing, if you can wait that long, I didnt.

recipes.title: Mini frittatas with quinoa
recipes.description: Need a gluten free hor d'oeuvre.  Mini frittatas with quinoa could be a great recipe to try.

ingredients.name: Quinoa
ingredients.original: 2 cups cooked quinoa (about ¾ cup uncooked)*

instructions: 1. In a large bowl mix to combine all the ingredients.
2. Grease a muffin tin and spoon mixture to the top of each cup.
3. Bake in an oven at 200C / 390F for 30 minutes, or until the edges of the frittatas are golden brown (do not under bake or they won't come out of the pan).
4. Let cool for at least 5 minutes in the tin before serving.
5. Eat hot or cold.
6. * Cook quinoa in 350 ml water for 20 minutes (or according to the package instructions). After cooking, leave to soak any remaining water for additional 5 minutes.

warnings: Low GD compliance - may not be suitable for gestational diabetes
recommendations: Serve with high-fiber sides like vegetables or whole grains

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Hummus
recipes.description: Peanut Butter Hummus is a gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian, and vegan recipe with 8 servings.  For 24 cents per serving, this recipe covers 7% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals.

ingredients.name: Chickpeas
ingredients.original: 1 can (19 oz/540 mL) chickpeas, drained and rinsed

instructions: 1. Place all ingredients in a food processor or blender. Whirl until smooth.
2. Serve with veggies and crackers.Tip: If a thinner hummus is preferred, add additional water or lemon juice to taste.

recipes.title: Quinoa Tabbouleh Salad
recipes.description: Quinoa Tabbouleh Salad requires about 45 minutes from start to finish.  For 52 cents per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals.

ingredients.name: Mint
ingredients.original: 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh mint, finely minced

ingredients.name: Lemon Juice
ingredients.original: 1/4 cup lemon juice, or less (to taste- I like a lot!)

ingredients.name: Freshly Cracked Pepper
ingredients.original: Freshly cracked black pepper, to taste

instructions: 1. Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan.

2. Add quinoa and stir. Cover and reduce heat. Allow quinoa to simmer on medium-low heat until all water is cooked off, about 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Be careful not to burn your quinoa. Allow to cool.
3. Place cooled quinoa into a large bowl (preferably something with an airtight lid).
4. Add all remaining ingredients and gently stir until very well-mixed. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour.
5. Stir again before serving.
6. Can be stored, covered, in the refrigerator for two or three days. But it's best on the first day, when the veggies are still fresh and crisp!

recipes.title: Roasted Beet Hummus
recipes.description: Roasted Beet Hummus requires roughly 45 minutes from start to finish.  This recipe serves 10.
instructions: 1. Place all ingredients except for the chickpeas and olive oil in a food processor or blender.Pulse until well blended.
2. Add the chickpeas and olive oil and pulse until just incorporated.
3. Add more olive oil as necessary for blending the chickpeas into a paste, or to thin out the hummus to a thinner consistency.
4. Serve with warm pita or flat bread.

recipes.title: Spicy Indian-Style Hummus
recipes.description: You can never have too many middl eastern recipes, so give Spicy Indian-Style Hummus a try.  For 44 cents per serving, you get a hor d'oeuvre that serves 12.

ingredients.name: Parsley
ingredients.original: 1/2 cup fresh parsley or cilantro, chopped

ingredients.name: Ground Pepper
ingredients.original: fresh ground black pepper to taste

ingredients.name: Olive Oil
ingredients.original: 2 - 3 tablespoons olive oil (or more to achieve your desired consistency

ingredients.name: Chilies
ingredients.original: 2 fresh green or red chilies, seeded and chopped

ingredients.name: Sea Salt
ingredients.original: 1 teaspoon sea salt, or to taste

instructions: 1. Rinse the chickpeas and soak for 8 hours or overnight covered in several inches of water with a little yogurt whey or lemon juice added.

2. Drain and rinse, then transfer to a large saucepan.  Cover with several inches of fresh water, bring to a boil, reduce the heat to medium-low and cover.  Simmer for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until the beans are buttery soft.

3. Drain.In a food processor, combine all of the ingredients and process until you have a thick, smooth paste. You may need to add extra olive oil or a bit of water if you want a thinner paste. Makes 3 cups, nutrition information is based on 1/4 cup serving.
